page.title: 03THE PEOPLE OF WYKE
page.content: The majority of people living in the area are of European origin, but being part of Bradford with its multi-ethnic background most races are represented. Most of the coloured people in Wyke own shops, the Pakistanis and Indians owning newsagents and grocery shops, whilst the Chinese run hot food take-aways. A large number of Asian children are bussed into the area to attend Wyke Manor Upper School. Although Wyke and its surrounding area is now a satellite of the ever growing city of Bradford, it still retains something of a village identity and most people are very satisfied with the services and amenities provided locally and close to in the City Centre.
